commentBody:
Gregg Easterbrook, I respectfully beg to differ.
You have been described as "thoughtful".
Your NYTimes article quotes you as stating, "If you didn't like Denver v. Carolina, you don't like sports".
You laud development of civic spirit, learning teamwork & self-discipline & enhanced college admission possibilities.
I love participatory sports, especially the ones modeled by my parents, most of which require teamwork, discipline & practice, such as running, tennis, swimming, diving, Pony-Clubbing, beagling, lacrosse, soccer & skiing.
Helmets are not the problem. It's the concussive force of soft brain tissue against the hard bony skull.
I'm taking my cues from the research of Bennet Omalu, MD & Ann Mckee, MD.
I will rejoice when American football is no longer played by any age.
As for TV viewers, they are living through others just like the Romans of old were fed "Bread & Circus" as they watched gladiatorial "contests".
